Documentation.short_help: Performs SLAM algorithm based Velodyne's sensor outputted point cloud
Documentation.long_help: Performs SLAM algorithm based Velodyne's sensor outputted point cloud. The SLAM algorithm is composed of three sequential steps: - Sampling strategy: extract keypoints that provide strong geometric information - Ego Motion: Sensor motion estimation between two frames - Mapping: Map the frame in a environment map

SourceProxy.Documentation: filter which performs slam on points data.

IntVectorProperty.name: Fast Slam
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If fast slam is enable we remove the extraction of blobs point in the Keypoint extraction step

IntVectorProperty.name: Display Mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If set display mode is enable, some extra arrays area added to the SLAM output to display the SLAM algorithm internal variables (the keypoints labels, the value of the computed geometric features, ...). It is very usefull when debugging and improving the SLAM

IntVectorProperty.name: Undistortion Model
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If undistortion model is enabled, the SLAM will use a motion model to undistorded the acquired frame during a sweep of the lidar. If it is not enabled, the slam will compute a rigid transform that will be applied to the all frame without taking into acocunt the distortion due to the liadr motion during a sweep

IntVectorProperty.name: Neighbor Width
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Number of neighbors used to estimate the scan lines scores (curvature, angles, depth gap, ...)

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Minimum Distance To Sensor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimal distance between a point and the sensor to be processed for the keypoint extraction. In other words, all points too close from the sensor are automatically rejected. In meters

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Minimum Sinus To Be Considered As Edge
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the angle between the two lines that fit its previous and next neighborhood. If the angle is close enought to 90° (sin(Angle) high enought) we consider the point as an edge keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Maximum Sinus To Be Considered As Planar
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as a planar keypoint is to compute the angle between the two lines that fit its previous and next neighborhood. If the angle is close enought to 0° or 180° (sin(Angle) low enought) we consider the point as a planar keypoint.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Minimum Depth Gapt To Be Considered As Edge
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: One strategy to consider a point as an edge keypoint is to compute the gap between the point and its neighborhood. Its left and right neighborhood are fitted with a line and we then compute the gap as being the distance between the point and the fitted lines. If the gap is high enought, we consider the point as an edge keypoint

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Angle Resolution Between Two Firing
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Azimutal angle resolution of the Velodyne sensor. This angle resolution is used to compute an expected distance between two consecutives firing. From this expected distance, we can detect if a point is a potential gap and launch more investigation

IntVectorProperty.name: Lev-Mardt Maximum Iteration
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The sensor motion estimation is performed using an ICP Mahalanobis distance function. This lead to a numerical optimization problem with a non-linear least square cost function (with a loss-function). To solve this optimization problem we use the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm which is an iterative algorithm.

IntVectorProperty.name: ICP Maximum Itertation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The sensor motion estimation is performed using an ICP Mahalanobis distance function. The ICP algorithm is an iterative algorithm and the number of iteration has to be settled

IntVectorProperty.name: # Edges Neighbors Minimum After Ransac
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: In the Ego-Motion step, the neighborhood of an edge keypoint is fitted using a ransac algorithm. This parameter settled the minimum number of inlier we want to consider the point

IntVectorProperty.name: # Edge Neighbors
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: K-nearest neighbors point to consider to compute the Variance-Covariance matrix of the neighborhood to define the Mahalanobis distance function.

IntVectorProperty.name: # Plane Neighbors
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: K-nearest neighbors points to consider to compute the Variance-Covariance matrix of the neighborhood to define the Mahalanobis distance function.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Linearity Factor #1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Reject an edge keypoint if its neighborhood is not distributed along a line eigenvalue1 > Factor * eigenvalue2

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Planarity Factor #1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Reject a planar keypoint if its neighborhood is not distributed along a plane: Factor1 * eigenvalue2 > eigenvalue1 and eigenvalue2 > Factor2 * eigenvalue3

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Planarity Factor #2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Reject a planar keypoint if its neighborhood is not distributed along a plane: Factor1 * eigenvalue2 > eigenvalue1 and eigenvalue2 > Factor2 * eigenvalue3

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Max Edge-Neighbors Distance To Fitted Line
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Reject an edge point if its neighborhood has points that are too far from the fitted line (degenerated ellipsoid)

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Max Plane-Neighbors Distance To Fitted Plane
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Reject a planar point if its neighborhood has points that are too far from the fitted plane (degenerated ellipsoid)

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Map Voxel Grid Leaf Size
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Size of the leaf when downsampling the environment map using a voxel grid filter. It should not be too big or some high frequency geometric information will be lost. It should not be too low or the geometric information will be too local

IntVectorProperty.name: Map Voxel Grid Size
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Size of the map used to store the keypoints. The map needs to have a size sufficient to store at least one frame.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Map Voxel Grid Resolution
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Resolution of the map. It should not be too big or too much points will be considered when trying to position the frame in the position.This do not impact accuracy but only speed.
